datafield.subfield: Kifāyat al-mutaḥaffiẓ wa-nihāyat al-mutalaffiẓ fī al-lughah al-ʻArabīyah
Shelfmark: Ann Arbor, University of Michigan, Special Collections Library, Isl. Ms. 615
Origin: As appears in colophon on p.50, transcription completed Rabīʻ II 1008 [November 1599].
Accompanying materials: a. Acquisitions slip from Yahuda.
Former shelfmark: From lower cover label and spine label, "IL 305" (likely supplied by Yahuda, see acquisitions slip).

Binding: Thin boards covered in pieced coated paper (dark pink/mauve and white, mottled with sponge painted or faux marbled look) with dark blue cloth over spine ; Type III binding (without flap) ; board linings in untinted paper ; sewn in light pink thread, two stations ; overall in fair condition with some abrasion ; textblock likely never attached to cover, which is quite ill-fitting and serves as a wrapper.

Support: European laid paper with 8 laid lines per cm. (vertical), chain lines spaced 28-30 mm. apart (horizontal), anchor in circle with leaf above watermark (see p.2, 40, etc.) and "T B" under trefoil countermark (see p.36, etc.).
Decoration: Keywords and section headings rubricated.

Script: Naskh ; angular 'Syrian' or Turkish hand in a narrow line ; virtually serifless with many closed counters, pointing in strokes rather than distinct dots, rounded, kāf mashqūqah preferred, etc.
Layout: Written in 23 lines per page ; frame-ruled.

Collation: 2 V(20), III (26), I (28) ; two quinions, ternion and single bifolium ; final three leaves left blank ; catchwords present ; pagination in pencil, Western numerals, supplied during digitization.
Colophon: "Scribal," triangular, reads "تم كتاب كفاية المتحفظ في اللغة في اواخر شهر ربيع الثاني من شهور سنة ثمان بعد الالف من الهجرة النبوية"
Explicit: "والذبالة الفتيلة وجمعها ذبال وهي الشعيلة ايضا وجمعها شعائل والله اعلم"

Incipit: "الحمد لله رب العالمين وصلى الله على محمد خاتم النبيين وعلى اله وصحبه اجمعين هذا كتاب مختصر في اللغة وما يحتاج اليه من غريب الكلام اودعناه كثيرا من الاسماء والصفات وجنبناه وحشي الالفاظ واللغات ..."
Fine copy of the popular lexicographical compendium by the Arab philologist Ibn al-Ajdābī (Abū Isḥāq Ibrāhīm ibn Ismāʻīl ibn Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Ṭarābulusī, d.before 1203? or 1257?).
Acquired in 1926 from the bookseller Isaac Benjamin S.E. Yahuda via purchase transacted on his behalf by Abraham Shalom Yahuda (1877-1951), his younger brother.

Former owners' marks include two ownership statements and two circular seal impressions on 'title page' (p.1), one statement nearly effaced, the other (dated 1319 [1901 or 2]) in name of Ḥasan ibn [?] Muḥammad al-Rizq Ḥamawī (حسن ابن محمد الرزق حموى ) who purchased the book from al-Shaykh Aḥmad (compare statements in Isl. Ms. 500, 619, and 623) ; ownership statement at close on p.50 in name of al-Sayyid ʻUmar al-Kīlānī (السيد عمر الكيلاني) ; rare marginal correction (see p.28).
كفاية المتحفظ ونهاية المتلفظ في اللغة العربية
